messages: c79794c82aabbd9aa7a30e73a9f3d8ce (10:46): I'm looking for a solution for running all my programs in a controlled enviroment, I have this wrapper image in my head of operating systems wrapping around programs and allowing them to access certain parts of the filesystem, network etc (basically all resources) on a least privledge basis. Does anyone know of such a solution? All help/suggestions are greatly appreciated. Thanks.
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:51): wmii in pkgsrc is severely outdated and the snapshot it refers to can't be found anywhere :)
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:52): Why not import the pkgsrc-wip packagee?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:52): Chamillioniare: Have a look at systrace
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:52): I finally found a 54mbps wifi card for netbsd :)
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:53): cards listing in man pages are useful !
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:53): I'm using a ralink card
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:53): A usb one from ASUS
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:53): I have a PCMCIA ralink card
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:53): But don't use their drivers :P
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:53): it is a WL-107g I guess
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:53): now I've found a WMP55AG for half the price it used to be
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:54): Is it an unwritten rule that hardware manufacturers can't write device drivers? :)
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:54): Do you use some docklet for interfacing with wpa_supplicant?
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:55): I run it with -B and let it play in background
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:55): Well, if you're using a laptop it sucks to config it manually every time
c79794c82aabbd9aa7a30e73a9f3d8ce (10:56): dynek, I've seen that multiple times now "s/x/y" and I'm only just worked out what it means, am I correct? Substitute X for Y?
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:56): oh well makes it look smarter for people who dont know what you're doing :)
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:56): carneous-: hmm, I didn't know about that one
2ad13ffdb6e4e3bf432da1969a09890c (10:57): s3: did you do a full install of nBSD?
c61f11ba0bb8594e4b4343debe4614bf (10:57): iNick : i just installed Xorg
2ad13ffdb6e4e3bf432da1969a09890c (10:58): then sjamaan's directions will work (temporary)  change the skel dir (not sure where it is) and each profile you use X in.
2ad13ffdb6e4e3bf432da1969a09890c (10:58): i think the file you'd edit is ~/.profile (could be wrong) -- maybe ~/.login
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:58): Or make it global in /etc/profile
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (10:59): Time to leave for work
a19d4345d335ac2bd1b38059f9e71ef9 (11:07): is there a way to have some resource restriction (namely memory) for a process in netbsd?
c61f11ba0bb8594e4b4343debe4614bf (11:07): iNick : how i wanna Add /usr/X11R6/bin to $PATH ?
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:08): s3tup, what shell do you use ?
a19d4345d335ac2bd1b38059f9e71ef9 (11:09): dynek: the problem is that the process/program is very buggy, so it kills pagerdaemon with it's memory allocations
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:09): use a sandbox it may help
a19d4345d335ac2bd1b38059f9e71ef9 (11:11): Nodsu: hmm maybe it would help :P
c61f11ba0bb8594e4b4343debe4614bf (11:16): dynek : i still dont understand
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:17): you should have a .kshrc filew
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:17): in which you put stuff for ksh
c61f11ba0bb8594e4b4343debe4614bf (11:18): i thinnk i only have .cshrc .shrc
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (11:26): so you are using the default csh maybe?
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (11:29): do you have a .profile file?
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (11:30): s3tup: create a .kshrc, and add  export PATH=/sbin:/usr/sbin:/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/pkg/sbin:/usr/pkg/bin:/usr/X11R6/bin
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:34): yeah it's not that hard :)
